introduction.p1: Gluco Check brings Nightscout to your Google Assistant. Ask it things like Hey Google, ask Gluco Check...
introduction.features1: my blood sugar / my BG / my glucose / ...
introduction.features2: my insulin on board / IOB / insulin
introduction.features3: my carbs on board / COB / carbs
introduction.features5: How old is my cannula / When did I insert my cannula?

welcome.title: Welcome to Gluco Check
welcome.content: Content about the product, more practical scenarios featuring ways to use it in your life in novel ways.

settings.title: Edit Settings
settings.content: Content about how the product must connect to your nightscout site in order to work.

helperText.nightscoutToken: Not sure how to get a token? Read on!
helperText.nightscoutUrl: URL of your Nightscout site (just the base URL, no /api)

submitStatus.error: Something has gone horribly wrong saving your settings

tokenDialog.title: How to get a token
tokenDialog.preamble: Some features of Gluco-Check (list them) require a token from your Nightscout site. Here's how you get one!
tokenDialog.step1: Make sure your site is on (minimum version) of Nightscout. You can check the version by clicking on the hamburger menu... ...and then scrolling down to the about box.
tokenDialog.step2: If you need an upgrade, you can read more about how to do that [here](http://www.nightscout.info/wiki/welcome/how-to-update-to-latest-cgm-remote-monitor-aka-cookie). If you do not need an upgrade... let's goooooo!
tokenDialog.step5: Click on "Add new Role", populate the Role with the values pictured below, and click save.
tokenDialog.step6: Click on "Add new Subject", populate the Subject with the values pictured below, and click save.
tokenDialog.step7: Copy the value in the "Access Token" column, paste it into the Nightscout Token field in [Gluco-Check Settings](url to that), and click save.
